{"step_by_step_thinking": "A suprasellar cystic mass refers to a type of tumor that is located above the sella turcica, a saddle-shaped area in the sphenoid bone of the human skull. Medulloblastoma is a type of brain tumor that usually occurs in the cerebellum, not the suprasellar region. Meningioma is a tumor that arises from the meninges, the membranes that surround your brain and spinal cord. Secondaries refer to metastatic tumors, which are not typically cystic and are rare in children. Craniopharyngioma, on the other hand, is a benign brain tumor that is often cystic and is commonly found in the suprasellar region, especially in children.", "answer_choice": "B. Craniopharyngioma"}
